sources.full: Light Party 5e - A Final Fantasy XIV conversion to Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your tough scales provide you extra protection. When you aren’t wearing armor, your base AC is 12 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield’s benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Cranial Horns
entries: Your horns grant you an enhanced sense of perception and spatial awareness. You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency in two melee weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As an au ra, you come from either the raen or xaela clans, each of which gives you different benefits.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As an elezen, you hail from one of two clans; either the duskwight or wildwood. Choose either of these clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Claws
entries: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you can deal slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Weapon Smith
entries: Your people are known for crafting unique weapons. You have proficiency in your choice of Smith’s Tools or Tinker’s Tools.

entries.name: Courage and Fealty
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being Charmed or Frightened.

entries.name: Bolstering Roar
entries: As a bonus action, you let out a battle cry that rouses your fighting spirit. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
This trait gains an additional effect based on your choice of subrace.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As a hrothgar, you belong to one of two clans, the Helion or the Lost. While the two clans have little-to-no physical differences, slight differences in history and culture give you unique features. Choose from either the Helion or Lost clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Broad Skillset
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice, one tool or gaming set of your choice, and you know one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Adaptable
entries: You are adept at adjusting to unfamiliar situations. When you make an attack roll, ability check or saving throw that doesn’t already include your proficiency bonus, you can choose to add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to that roll.

entries.name: Migratory
entries: Your body is built for long journeys on foot. You have advantage on saving throws against Exhaustion caused by a forced march during travel.

entries.name: Fast Learner
entries: It takes you half as much time to learn a new language or set of tools.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As a hyur, you descend from one of two clans; either the Midlander or Highlander clans. Choose either of these clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Lalafellin Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Scurry
entries: You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action. Whenever you take the Disengage action, your speed increases by 5 feet until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Tradesmen
entries: You have proficiency in one tool of your choice.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As a lalafell, you descend from one of two clans; either the Plainsfolk and Dunesfolk clans. Choose either of these clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 35 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colours in that darkness only as shades of grey.

entries.name: Keen Awareness
entries: Your senses have been honed by generations of hunting. You have a +2 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score and to any Wisdom (Perception) checks you make.

entries.name: Hunter's Stride
entries: You can take the Dash action as a bonus action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: As a miqo’te, you belong to either the Seekers of the Sun clan, or the Keepers of the Moon clan. Choose either of these clans as your subrace.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying weight and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Roegadyn Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Endless Stamina
entries: You can use your action to tap into the endless well of stamina within you. You regain a number of hit points equal to your level, and reduce your exhaustion level, if any, by 1. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: Among roegadyn, there are two distinct clans, each with their own unique physiology and cultures. Choose from the sea wolf or hellsguard subraces.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 35 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of yourself as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries: Your long jump distance increases by 10 feet, and your high jump increases by 5 feet. You also don’t need a running start to gain the full effects of a jump.

entries.name: Long Fall
entries: Making your home in the trees teaches you to fall from them safely. When you fall and aren’t incapacitated, you can subtract up to 20 feet from the fall when calculating the fall’s damage.

entries.name: Hidden Hunter
entries: You can take the Hide action as a bonus action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: The different lifestyles and adaptations of the rava and veena clan provide slight but meaningful differences in the two. Choose from the rava or veena subraces.

entries.name: Social Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Insight, Performance or Persuasion.

entries.name: Loyalty
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

entries.name: Will of Azim
entries: When you make a saving throw and fail, you can use your reaction to roll a d6 and add it to the save, potentially turning the failure into a success. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
As a member of the auri raen clan, you have integrated into the cultures of the Far East, granting you unique traits that reflects your social nature and iron will.

entries.name: Warrior's Insight
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Athletics or Intimidation.

entries.name: Nomadic Wanderer
entries: Hardened by many years of wandering the steppe, your walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Might of Nhaama
entries: When you make a weapon attack and miss, you can use your reaction to roll a d6 and add it to the roll, potentially turning the miss into a hit. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
As a member of the auri xaela clan, you are part of a nomadic warrior culture, granting you unique traits that reflects your combat skill and fiery will.

entries.name: Traditional Tools
entries: You have proficiency in your choice of mason’s tools or potter’s tools.

entries.name: Sensitive Hearing
entries: Thanks to your sensitive ears, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception), Wisdom (Survival), and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on hearing.
Additionally, you can take the Search action as a bonus action, using the uncanny awareness granted by your senitive hearing to listen for signs of enemies.

The duskwight elezen dwell in the caves beneath the black shroud. Many years of living in the dark, dank tunnels have blessed them with phenomenal hearing. Their traditions hold fast to the arts of stonecarving and pottery.

entries.name: Gridanian Training
entries: You have proficiency with shortbows and longbows. Additionally, you gain proficiency in one of the following musical instruments of your choice: flute, lute, lyre or viol.

entries.name: Hawk Shot
entries: Your impeccable eyesight allows you to make attacks at long range. When you make a ranged attack, you can increase the range of the attack by 30 feet. If the attack uses a weapon, both the long and normal ranges are increased.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest, and you can use it no more than once per turn.

The wildwood elezen primarily hail from the forest city of Gridania. Their ancestors created the arts of archery and string musical instruments, traditions which are taught to most wildwood elezen in the modern day. They also possess fantastic eyesight, which aids in their use of ranged weapons.

entries.name: Holy Scriptures
entries: You have proficiency in the Religion skill. Additionally, you have advantage on checks made to recall information about the goddess Halone.

entries.name: Halone's Fury
entries: You can channel your holy fervour through your weapons. When you hit a target with a simple or martial weapon, you can cause the target to take extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest, and you can use it no more than once per turn.
For generations the proud city of Ishgard stood as a beacon for the virtues of the church. The people’s devotion to their religion has given rise to a devout and noble culture.

entries.name: Roar of Fealty
entries: When you use your Bolstering Roar, you end the Charmed condition on yourself and creatures of your choice within 10 feet.
The life of a helion revolves around their queen. Helions are unwavering in their loyalty, both to their queen and their allies.

entries.name: Roar of Courage
entries: When you use your Bolstering Roar, you end the Frightened condition on yourself and creatures of your choice within 10 feet.
Having lost or abandoned their queen, The Lost value their freedom and travel the world in search of new meaning.

entries.name: Natural Companion
entries: You have proficiency in the Persuasion skill.

entries.name: Tool Master
entries: Choose one of your tool proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your chosen tool.
Midlanders are widespread and quickly adopt the social norms of where they settle. They are naturally amicable with the people they meet, and put particular focus into mastering their professions.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

entries.name: Martial Training
entries: You are proficient in two martial weapons of your choice.
Highlanders are much less populous, and hail primarily from the mountains of Gyr Abania. Their bodies and cultures have been harded by generations of conflict.

entries.name: Natural Insight
entries: You have proficiency in the Insight skill.

entries.name: Loyalty
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.
Like most Hyur, those in the far east are adaptable, but have unique traits brought about by their wildly different cultures.

entries.name: Natural Naturalist
entries: You have proficiency in the Nature skill.

entries.name: Padjali Magic
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.
Padjal are horned, youthful Hyur rarely born within the Black Shroud. Ironically, they are not a natural occurence; rather, they are gifted power from birth by the Elementals.

entries.name: Agrarian Folk
entries: You have proficiency in the Nature skill.

entries.name: Prarie Camoflague
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in grassland or forest terrain.
The Plainsfolk inhabit the grasslands of western Eorzea, primarily on the island of Vylbrand, but some have made their way east and settled in the lands in and around the Black Shroud.

entries.name: Merchant Folk
entries: You have proficiency in the Deception skill.

entries.name: Acclimatised
entries: You are naturally adapted to harsh desert heat. You are immune to the effects of extreme heat.

entries.name: Dust Shield
entries: Your eyes are covered in a thin membrane that keeps out desert sands and sunlight. You have advantage on saving throws against being blinded.
The Dunesfolk dwell in the deserts of Thanalan, and are naturally adapted to the harsh climates therein.

entries.name: Miner Folk
entries: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill.

entries.name: Heavy Handed
entries: You ignore the Heavy property of weapons.

entries.name: Strong Stomach
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against the Poisoned condition.

On The First, a parallel world to the one that contains Eorzea, Lalafell are known as Dwarves. A similarly stout and hardy folk, they dwell in the northern mountains of Norvrandt, and are known for their face-obscuring helmets and beard-like scarves.

entries.name: Superior Dash
entries: When you take the Dash action, your gain an additional 15 feet of movement for the current turn.

entries.name: Natural Climber
entries: You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

Seekers of the Sun are diurnal hunters, and frequently worshippers of Azeyama, the Warden. They possess fierce agility and stamina, capable of chasing prey through the desert heat with ease, and thanks to their natural talent for climbing, they often find work as sailors.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the dark of night, you have even greater darkvision than that of your cousins. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern colour in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Veil of the Moon
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in darkness.

Nocturnal hunters with a matriarchal society, the Keepers of the Moon are frequently worshippers of Menphina. They make their home in the cool, dark barrows of the Black Shroud, hunting the forest’s myriad beasts and trading the spoils in exchange for agricultural goods.

entries.name: Natural Swimmer
entries: Thanks to your life at sea, you have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Sea Legs
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone.

entries.name: Navigator
entries: You have proficiency in navigator’s tools.

Descended from the pirates that plagued the Northern Empty, the Sea Wolves are most at home on the seas or in the maritime city of Limsa Lominsa. True to their roots, many make a name for themselves as pirates, navigators of fishermen.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Navigator
entries: You have proficiency in smith's tools.

Making their home in the rugged mountains of Abalathia’s Spine, the Hellsguard are few in number but great in spirit. They are proud warriors, with bodies and spirits tempered by the unforgiving heat of their volcanic homeland.

entries.name: Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency in two martial weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Fearless
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.
A common site in the Far East and even amongst the forces of Garlemald, the Othardian Roegadyn resemble the Hellsguard in appearance, though with paler skin that sets them apart.

entries.name: Nature's Step
entries: Accustomed to weaving through the dense foliage of the jungle, you can move through nonmagical difficult terrain without expending extra movement, if you are using your walking speed on the ground or a floor.

entries.name: Jungle Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in jungle or forest terrain.
Dwelling in the Golmore Jungle, the Rava’s umber skin helps them blend into the forest to ambush their prey.

entries.name: Mountain Acclimation
entries: You have resistance to cold damage. You also naturally acclimate to high altitudes, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.
Making their homes in the forests surrounding the Skatay Range, the Veena are well adapted to their mountainous, snowcapped surroundings.

default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapons}
(a) a {@item pistol|DMG} and 20 {@item Renaissance Bullet|DMG|bullets} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|PHB} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|PHB}
{@item chain mail|phb} and a set of {@item Smith's tools|PHB}

classFeature.name: Gunblade
entries: In your training, you have learned how to design and build your own gunblades. Over the course of an hour, you can use smith’s tools to convert a melee weapon into a gunblade. You can have up to two gunblades at once. If you attempt to construct a third, you must dissasemble one of your existing gunblades, converting it back into a normal melee weapon. A weapon you convert into a gunblade gains the following properties:
Weighty. Only you know how to wield the unique weight of your gunblade. If another creature tries to use your gunblade, it cannot add it’s proficiency bonus to the attack roll.

Lightning Shot. You can use your gunblade to make a simple ranged attack. The attack has a range of 30 feet and you are proficient with it. The attack uses your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls, the damage die is a {@dice 1d6}, and it deals lightning damage.
Additionally, when you reach 6th level, your gunblades count as magical for the purposes of overcoming weakness and resistance.

classFeature.name: Cartridges
entries: Also at 1st level, you have a number of aether–charged catridges that you can swiftly load into your gunblade and fire to unleash powerful cartridge features. You begin knowing three such features: Blasting Zone, Burst Strike and Heart of Stone. You learn more cartridge features as you gain levels in this class.
You must be wielding a gunblade to be able to fire a cartridge. A cartridge is expended after it is fired, and you regain all expended cartridges after finishing a short or long rest.
Some of your gunbreaker features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Blasting Zone
entries: As an action, you can fire a cartridge to instantly destroy a nonmagical, Medium or smaller object within reach of a gunblade you are wielding.
When you reach 11th level, the object can be Large or smaller, and when you reach 17th level, the object can be Huge or smaller.

classFeature.name: Burst Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee attack using a gunblade, you can fire a cartridge to follow up with a deadly blast. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 2d8} fire damage and is knocked prone. On a failed save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect. If the attack was a critical hit, the creature automatically fails the saving throw.

When you reach 11th level, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8}, and instead of knocking a creature prone on a failed save, you can push it back up to 15 feet. When you reach 17th level, the damage increases to {@dice 4d8}.

classFeature.name: Heart of Stone
entries: When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to fire a cartridge, creating a magical barrier around the target, that reduces the damage taken by {@dice 1d8} + your Constitution modifier (minimum reduction of 1).
When you reach 11th level, the range increases to 60 feet, and when you reach 17th level, the range increases to 90 feet.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can’t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Brutal Shell
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you are able to use the excess aether from your cartridges defensively. Whenever you fire a cartridge, and you gain 5 temporary hit points which last for 1 minute.

Additionally, when you use Heart of Stone and target another creature, you can choose to have that creature gain the temporary hit points from this feature, rather than you. When you do so, the temporary hit points last until the start of the creature’s next turn.
When you reach 11th level, the number of temporary hit points you gain increases to 10, and when you reach 17th level, it increases to 15.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Contingent
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you undergo specialised training, joining a contingent of like-minded gunbreakers. Through your contingent, you learn unique techniques and abilities to use in conjunction with your gunblade. Choose from the Queen’s Guard, Ravager, Elementalist or Shadowhunter Contingents, each of which is presented at the end of the class description. The contingent you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Deft Hands
entries: By 6th level, you have become more adept at handling your gunblade and tools. You can convert a weapon into a gunblade in half the time it would normally take, and you can repair objects using your smith’s tools twice as fast. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make using Smith’s Tools.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Contingent Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Contingent.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Heart of Light
entries: Starting at 9th level, whenever a creature you can see forces you to make a saving throw against a spell or other magical effect, you can use your reaction to fire a cartridge and release a surge of defensive energy. You and any other creature within 30 feet that was also forced to make the saving throw have advantage on the roll.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Contingent Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Contingent.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Enforcer
entries: At 13th level, your imposing presence emboldens your allies. When you or a creature within 30 feet of you makes a Charisma check, the creature gains a bonus to the roll equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of +1). You must be conscious and visible to grant this bonus.

classFeature.name: Continuation
entries: At 14th level, you are able to capitalise on the momentum from your gunblade. When you hit a creature with a melee attack using a gunblade, you can fire a cartridge as a bonus action to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature suffers one of the following effects of your choice:
Abdomen Tear. The creature has disadvantage on the next Strength or Dexterity saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.
Eye Gouge. The creature is blinded until the end of your next turn.
Jugular Rip. The creature can’t cast any spells that require a verbal component, and can speak only falteringly until the end of your next turn.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Contingent Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Contingent.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Bloodfest
entries: Starting at 18th level, when you roll initiative and have no cartridges remaining, you regain 2 cartridges.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Martial Versatility (Optional)
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Gunmetal Soul
entries: By the time you reach 20th level, your body and soul has been hardened by war. You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. Additionally, whenever you use Heart of Stone and target another creature, you can extend this benefit to them. The creature gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage until the start of its next turn, including against the triggering damage.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilant Companion
entries: At 3rd level, you are a dependable and vigilant ally. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made while standing watch, and you have a +2 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Perception) score while a friendly creature is within 30 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Royal Guard
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you defend your allies even at risk to yourself. You can fire a cartridge as a bonus action to protect a creature you can see within 5 feet, erecting a defensive ward and interjecting yourself between friend and foe until the start of your next turn.

While the creature is protected, it has half cover. If the creature takes damage from any source while protected, they take only half damage, while you take the other half. The effect ends early if you and the creature are separated by more than 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Nebula
entries: Starting at 7th level, you are able to make the most of your own defences. While you have temporary hit points, you have a +1 bonus to AC.

subclassFeature.name: Aurora
entries: At 10th level, you master an enigmatic technique to prolong yourself on the front lines. As an action, you can fire a cartridge and envelop yourself in healing light. For 1 minute, you regain {@dice 1d4} hit points at the start of each of your turns. You don’t gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Superbolide
entries: From 15th level, whenever you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can fire a cartridge as a reaction to drop to 1 hit point instead. When you do so, you have resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: No Mercy
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can fire a cartridge as a bonus action to empower yourself with a merciless fury. Until the end of your turn, you gain the following benefits:
Your melee weapon attacks using a gunblade score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
You have advantage on melee weapon attacks using a gunblade if the target has less than half its maximum hit points.
This effect ends early if you are incapacitated, or if your turn ends and you haven’t taken the Attack action.

subclassFeature.name: Brutal Visage
entries: Also at 3rd level, your merciless combat style invokes fear in all that have seen you in battle. You can use your Strength modifier in place of Charisma when making Intimidation checks. You have advantage on Inimidation checks against creatures that have seen you fight. You can also fire a cartridge when you make an Intimidation check to give yourself advantage on the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Rough Divide
entries: When you reach 7th level, you become able to propel yourself through the air by firing a cartridge. As a bonus action, you can fire a cartridge and move up to 30 feet in any direction without provoking attacks of opportunity.

subclassFeature.name: Terminal Trigger
entries: At 10th level, your ruthless onslaught cripples your foes. When you reduce a creature to less than half its maximum hit points, you can fire a cartridge as a bonus action to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is stunned until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Wicked Talon
entries: Starting at 15th level, you become able to brutally exploit the pain of your enemies. When you score a critical hit against a creature using your gunblade, the next attack you make against the same creature also becomes a critical hit. You can only gain this benefit once on each of your turns.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Cartridges
entries: At 3rd level, you have learned to imbue your cartridges with elemental power. When you finish a short or long rest, choose one of the following damage types to infuse into your cartridges: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The damage type of your gunblades Lightning Shot and your Burst Strikes changes to your chosen damage type until you choose a different one using this feature. You also gain one of the following benefits, determined by your choice of damage type.
Acid. As an action, you can touch a tiny metal object, such as a lock or key, with your gunblade to rapidly corrode it. The object takes 1d6 acid damage.
Cold. As an action, you can freeze a 5-foot cube of water, provided there are no creatures in it. The ice thaws after one minute, or after you use this feature again.
Fire. You can use your action to touch a flammable object with your gunblade and ignite it.
Lightning. You can use your action to touch a living creature that has 0 hit points with your gunblade, sending a jolt of lightning through it. The creature becomes stable.
Thunder. You can use your action to create a loud burst of sound that can be heard up to 100 feet away.

subclassFeature.name: Fated Circle
entries: Also at 3rd level, when you take the attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks to fire a cartridge and unleash elemental energy around you. Creatures within 15 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d8 damage, and is pushed back 10 feet. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is only pushed back 5 feet. The damage type is the same as the one you chose for your Elemental Cartridges.
The damage of this feature increase as you gain levels in this class, increasing to 2d8 at 11th level, and 3d8 at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Bow Shock
entries: Starting at 7th level, your elemental ammunition is so intense that it causes lingering damage. When you use Burst Strike or Fated Circle, you can fire a cartridge as a bonus action to afflict one creature that failed the save with lingering energy. Alternatively, if the creature failed the save by 5 or more, they become afflicted without you needing to fire a cartridge.
An afflicted creature takes an additional 1d4 damage of the same type as your Elemental Cartridges, and for 1 minute, the creature takes the same damage at the start of each of it’s turns.
The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of it’s turns, ending the effect on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Heart
entries: Staring at 10th level, you have resistance to the damage type you chose for your Elemental Cartridges, and when you use Heart of Stone and target another creature, the creature gains the same damage resistance damage until the start of its next turn, including against the triggering damage.

subclassFeature.name: Sonic Break
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can shatter a foes defences. When a creature fails the saving throw against Burst Strike, instead of knocking the creature prone, you can cause it to have vulnerability to one of the following damage types of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The vulnerability lasts until the end of your next turn. Once you use this feature against a creature, you can’t use it against that creature again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Lore
entries: At 3rd level, your training under the Shadow Hunter Contingent has taught you everything you need to know to destroy otherworldly creatures. You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, or fiends, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about such creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Brand
entries: Also at 3rd level, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack using a gunblade, you can fire a cartridge to magically brand the creature for 1 minute.

The first time on each of your turns you deal damage to the branded creature, it takes an additional {@dice 1d6} damage and whenever it makes a Concentration check, it subtracts a {@dice 1d6} from the roll. If the creature is an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey or fiend, the d6s become d8s, and you have a +1 bonus to attack rolls against the creature.
The brand lasts for 1 minute, or until you use this feature to brand a different creature.

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Lock
entries: Starting at 7th level, a creature branded by your Hunter’s Brand has its speed reduced by 10 feet.

Additionally, whenever the branded creature attempts to take the Dash action, teleport, or leave its current plane by any means, you can fire a cartridge as a reaction to force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the attempt to Dash, teleport or leave its current plane fails, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of your next turn.
An aberration, celestial, elemental, fey or fiend makes the saving throw at disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Vigil Ward
entries: By 10th level, you are so accustomed to dealing with extraplanar entities, that you have advantage on saving throws againt being charmed or frightened, and against any effect that would possess you or otherwise control you.

subclassFeature.name: Innocence
entries: Starting at 15th level, you smite your foes and refuse their return to life. When a creature branded by your hunter’s brand dies, it’s body is consumed and explodes. Creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the branded creature must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Afterwards, it’s body is reduced to a pile of fine gray dust, and it can only be restored to life by means of a true resurrection or wish spell. An aberration, celestial, elemental, fey or fiend makes the saving throw at disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Chemical Warfare
entries: At 3rd level, you’ve begun tinkering with chemicals and poisons, developing your skills in conjunction with your martial prowess. You gain the following benefits:
You gain proficiency with Alchemist’s Supplies.
You have advantage on saving throws against the Poisoned condition.
Your Burst Strike can deal your choice of acid, fire or poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Chemical Mine
entries: Also at 3rd level, you wield chemical weapons to control the battlefield. When you take the Attack action, you can forgo one of your attacks to fire a cartridge set a chemical mine in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you. The mine lasts for 1 minute, or until detonated. You can have a number of active mines equal to your proficiency bonus. If you attempt to set an additional mine while at your maximum, choose one of your active mines to detonate.
You can detonate the mine as a bonus action on your turn. Alternatively, you can detonate the mine as a reaction when a creature moves within 10 feet of it.

When the mine detonates, each creature within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 2d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The damage type is your choice of acid or poison.
The damage of your mines increases as you gain levels in this class, increasing to {@dice 3d6} at 11th level, and {@dice 4d6} at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Acrid Aura
entries: Starting at 7th level, after you use Burst Strike or Chemical Mine, an aura of poisonous gas extends 10 feet out from you until the end of your next turn. When a hostile creature starts its turn in the aura, or enters it for the first time on its turn, it takes poison damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
When you reach 15th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Mithradatism
entries: From 10th level, exposure to your own chemicals has granted you a modicum of resistance. You have resistance to acid and poison damage, and are immune to the poisoned condition.
Heart of Stone and target another creature, the creature gains resistance to acid and poison damage until the start of its next turn, including against the triggering damage.

subclassFeature.name: Kiss of Black Rose
entries: Finally, at 15th level, you learn to develop and wield the ultimate chemical weapons. Your Burst Strike and Chemical Mine can also deal necrotic damage. When you deal either acid, poison or necrotic damage to a creature using Burst Strike or Chemical Mine, you can fire a cartridge as a bonus action to force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it suffers one of the following effects, depending on the damage type you dealt.
Acid. You reduce the creature’s AC by 2 until the end of your next turn.
Poison. The creature becomes Blinded and Poisoned.
Necrotic. The creature’s max hp is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Gunner
entries: The damage die of your gunblade’s Lightning Shot increases to {@dice 1d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Provoker
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use a bonus action to provoke the creature until the start of your next turn. While provoked, the creature has disadvantage on attacks rolls against creatures other than you.
